algorithm_technique: Greedy approach with two pointers to match characters cyclically.
problem_summary_simple: Can we make str2 a subsequence of str1 by cyclically incrementing str1's characters at most once?
problem_summary_technical: Uses two pointers to iterate through str1 and str2, checking if str2 can be formed by cyclically incrementing str1 characters.
key_insights: The core idea is to greedily match characters of str2 with characters in str1.
Cyclic increment means checking the difference modulo 26, allowing at most one increment.
Two pointers efficiently track progress in both strings.
